abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a highly satisfactory
            project outcome, with a likely sustainability, and high
            institutional development impacts. Lessons are as follows.
            The project design concept of combining related sub-sectors
            in a broader sector project worked satisfactorily, in spite
            of the involvement of five agencies. Keys to success
            include: an effective multi-agency steering committee,
            empowered to make project cost and coordination decisions,
            allowing a balanced coordination between implementing
            agencies, with the provision that agency representatives
            were empowered; a Project Management Unit, supplemented by
            specific project support in each implementing agency, which
            proved critically important in this multi-agency project,
            also effective in building capacity due to the line
            reporting and accountability of each agency for authorizing
            project expenditures; intensive monitoring and supervision
            with a good skill mix, from both the Bank and Government;
            and, well-defined indicators relevant to each agency, and to
            the project. In addition, the two-phase Adaptable Program
            Lending (APL) structure worked well from the Project
            perspective, particularly with respect to the public sector
            reform activities, the phasing was helpful because of two
            agencies, whish despite of differing pace and targets from
            that expected at appraisal, both in the end exceeded
            targets. The public works experience shows that sector
            reform can be introduced smoothly when the timing is well
            chosen - in this case, alignment of a national reform
            agenda, sector political will, committed executive leader,
            comprehensive consultations, and a sound, well-designed
            plan. Notwithstanding, the introduction of hazard risk
            management into public sector management needs a number of
            elements to be successful, and, the preparation of fiduciary
            arrangements such as procurement, and financial management
            needs to cover the whole transaction cycle in order to
            streamline the process.
